data: They were not exactly of that conventional type which used to be common whenever two sisters had to be describedâ€”the one dark and the other fair, the one sunny and amiable, the other reserved and proud; the one gay, the other melancholy, or at least very serious by nature.

They were not exactly of that conventional type which used to be common whenever two sisters had to be described--the one dark and the other fair, the one sunny and amiable, the other reserved and proud; the one gay, the other melancholy, or at least very serious by nature.
